details.title: Bills to be tabled in Rajya Sabha
details.content:
1. The National Council for Teacher Education (Amendment) Bill, 2018

2. The Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education (Amendment) Bill, 2018.

3. The Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education (Amendment) Bill, 2018.

details.title: Bills to be taken up in Lok Sabha
details.content:
1. The Aadhaar and Other Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2018.

2. The Companies (Amendment) Bill, 2018.

3. The New Delhi International Arbitration Centre Bill, 2018.

4.The National Medical Commission Bill, 2017.

details.title: AIADMK MPs stage protest prior to today's session
details.content:
Delhi: AIADMK MPs protest in front of Mahatma Gandhi statue in the Parliament premises on Cauvery issue pic.twitter.com/EevMZoM3dI

— ANI (@ANI) January 2, 2019

details.title: Ravi Shankar Prasad to table Triple Talaq Bill
details.content: Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad will push for the Triple Talaq bill to be passed in the Rajya Sabha after the show down on December 31. The historic bill was passed by the lower House in December during the ongoing winter session.

details.title: What does the numbers say?
details.content:
The strength of the upper House stands at 244.

The BJP, who doesn't have a majority in Rajya Sabha will need 123 votes to pass the bill. The number of members opposing the bill is around 144. Around 80 members were in favour of the bill and the stand of around 20 MPs was either not declared or unclear.

details.title: Triple Talaq is a matter of gender equality, Sabarimala is about tradition: PM Modi
details.content:
Prime Minister tried to clear the air on BJP's apparent contradiction in its stand on the controversial Triple Talaq Ordinance and the ban on entry of women between the age group of (10-50 years) in the Sabarimala Temple by saying the Ordinance against Triple Talaq was brought keeping in mind gender equality and social justice and it should not be seen as interference in religious issues.

(Click here to read more)

details.title: Amit Shah arrives at the Parliament
details.content: (Photo| Shekhar Yadav/EPS)

details.title: Parliament proceedings begin for the day
details.content: Although the start to today's session has been shaky in Lok Sabha owing to sloganeering by the AIADMK members.

details.title: Venkaiah Naidu releases Rajya Sabha Calendar 2019 in Parliament today
details.content:
Releasing Rajya Sabha Calendar 2019 in Parliament today. This calendar has been conceived and designed in such a way that every page makes an illuminating reading with interesting information relevant to the tenure of each Chairman. #RajyaSabha pic.twitter.com/zC9tajBVB2

— VicePresidentOfIndia (@VPSecretariat) January 2, 2019

details.title: 'Media Mazak ura rahi hai'
details.content: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu asked the members of the Rajya Sabha to allow peaceful proceeding in the House. He added that the House needs to debate on important issues, which has not been possible since the beginning of the session. He followed it up by saying,"Media Mazak ura rahi hai (The media is making fun of us) for lack of performance".

details.title: Rahul Gandhi to lead Opposition in today's Rafale debate
details.content: Congress President Rahul Gandhi to participate in the discussion on Rafale in Lok Sabha today, reported ANI.

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned till 12 pm
details.content: The lower house will resume at 12 pm today.

details.title: Rajya Sabha adjourned till 11.40
details.content: The upper House will resume adjourned for 15 minutes.

details.title: Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala releases a clip of Goa cabinet minister Vishwajit Rane, who purportedly can be heard telling a person that Goa CM and former defence minister Manohar Parrikar has entire Rafale documents lying in his bedroom.
details.content:
देश जानना चाहता है :-

3. क्या भ्रष्टाचार की इसी कहानी के चलते चौकीदार संयुक्त संसदीय समिति (JPC) की मांग से कन्नी काट रहे हैं? https://t.co/rNXKplpnTL#RafaleAudioLeak

details.title: Rajya Sabha adjourned till 12 pm
details.content: The upper House has been further adjourned till 12 pm.

details.title: Rajya Sabha adjourned till 2pm
details.content: As soon as the upper House resumed, it was further adjourned till 2pm.

details.title: Ravi Shankar Prasad introduces the Aadhaar bill
details.content: Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad introduces the 'The Aadhaar and Other Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2018'. Sougata Roy and Shashi Tharoor oppose the bill calling it a violation of right to privacy.

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned till 2pm.
details.content: The lower house stands adjourned to meet at 2 pm. Soon after the House opens, Rahul Gandhi will take charge of the Opposition for the anticipated Rafale debate.

details.title: Rajya Sabha reconvenes post lunch
Rahul Gandhi to initiates the debate on Rafale deal in Lok Sabha
Rahul Gandhi launches attack on PM Modi on pricing amidst uproar by AIADMK members
details.content: "I watched PM's interview, he said that no one is accusing the PM on Rafale. It's not true. Why did the price go up from 526 crores to 1600 crores?" Gandhi asked.

details.title: Rajya Sabha adjourned till 2.28 pm
details.content: Rajya Sabha to reconvene at 2. 28pm.

details.title: 'Defence Minister is hiding behind AIADMK members and PM Modi in his bedroom'
details.content: "Why did you give this contract to your dear friend Anil Ambani? Defence Minister is hiding behind AIADMK members. The Defence Minister was contradicted by Emmanuel Macron himself," says Rahul Gandhi.

details.title: Rahul Gandhi wants to play the alleged audio on Rafale, Arun Jaitley demands verification
details.content: Rahul Gandhi wants to play the alleged Rafale deal leak. Finance Minister Arun Jaitley counters, saying he has to authenticate the recording. "Last time Rahul Gandhi concocted an entire conversation last time," says Jaitley

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned till 2.30 pm
details.content: Before the House was adjourned, Rahul Gandhi said he won't play the tape. Arun Jaitley accusing Rahul for lying on multiple occasions said, he's afraid to authenticate it which is why he backed off.

details.title: Speaker asks Rahul Gandhi not to take Anil Ambani's name
details.content: The speaker ruled that Rahul Gandhi should not take Anil Ambani's name while giving his statement.

details.title: The grand old party of India is run by someone who doesn't understand combat aircraft: Arun Jaitley
details.content: Countering Rahul Gandhi's claims, Arun Jaitley said," today he tried to play a tape and he was too afraid to authenticate it because it was concocted by his party. The manner in which he takes liberty on truth is absolutely unprecedented."

details.title: BJP rakes up Bofors scam, National Herald case
details.content: Amidst sloganeering of "Ma, beta chor hai (mother and son both are thieves)", Jailtey raked up Bofors scam which took place during Rajiv Gandhi's tenure. "If the fingers point at you in AugustaWestland, National Herald and Bofors, then it is a bit too much. Today, they have the audacity to raise an allegation against us," he added.

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned till 3.30 pm
details.content: The lower House will continue with the Rafale deal debate after reconvening at 3.30pm

details.title: Amid din, Rajya Sabha adjourned till 11 am tomorrow
Paper plane thrown in Parliament?
details.content:
During the discussion on #Rafale in Lok Sabha, Congress MP from Punjab Gurjeet Singh Aujla threw paper plane towards Finance Minister Arun Jaitley. Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman complained about it to the Lok Sabha speaker.

— ANI (@ANI) January 2, 2019

details.title: Rajya Sabha reconvenes, Arun Jaitley launches fresh attack on Congress
details.content: The Supreme Court said that the court doesn't want to interfere in pricing and yet to satisfy the consciousness the court read and cleared it. But the Congress party's election need is not getting satisfied: Arun Jaitley

details.title: NDA bought Rafale at 9% cheaper rate than UPA, says Jaitley
details.content: This is not a policy issue. If Supreme Court has already given its verdict, which Parliamentary committee will give a report over ruling the court? The partisan body can't investigate matters. This JPC is being sought by those who are drowning in corruptions.

details.title: TMC law maker Sougata Roy questions, why was Reliance made the offset partner given that they're reeling under debt?
Kalikesh Narayan Singh Deo claimed that Qatar bought Rafale at a cheaper price.
details.content: He also asked if HAL could produce fourth generation Sukhois then what was the need to change the partner?

Arvind Sawant,Shiv Sena in Lok Sabha: Kaisa offset contractor tha ki jiski company nahi thi abhi, sirf kaghaz pe thi, jab ki HAL ke paas sab tha. Hamari sarkar agar saaf hai to hum kyun darrte hain JPC se? #Rafaledeal pic.twitter.com/qZ6MDXRxKg

— ANI (@ANI) January 2, 2019

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned till January 3
details.content: The lower House has been adjourned to meet again on January 3 at 11am.
